text: What is everyone's thoughts on hidden generals?
What's a hidden general?
You make a deck with something as the Commander but the strategy is based around a different legendary creature in the deck
Josh Lee Kwai did it during a Game Knights episode by playing a Cromat deck that was really a Nekusar deck
Yeah he runs Cromat but it's actually a 5 color nekusar deck
I guess my question is why would you want to? Other than to surprise your playgroup once I guess
Smokescreen. Nekusar is a target, Cromat isn't.
It allows you to be ignored until your gameplan is ready to go online.
Sure, I think that gets everyone once but after they're hip to your nonsense...
It's probably better and more common when you play with a more rotating group

Tried it once using Titania in a Naya deck full of Armageddon effects. Plan was to drop her, destroy everything, and be left with a game-winning army. 
Performed very inconsistently. Wasn't much fun.
Bummer to hear <@U3MTJRAQL>
Sweet idea though
I did it with a K&T Elemental deck. The real commander was Angry Omnom. I liked it, let my wife be the main pilot of the deck and sure enough, it did work
The idea is something I'm going to target for my next article. Seems pretty janky.

To me it’s poor deckbuilding. The surprise only works once and then if the general gets exiled you’re DOA. That also only works once and your playgroup can adapt. It’s no biggie to Praetor’s Grasp (or similar) the hidden general away.
You aren't really supposed to run only one hidden general.
Honestly, the trick is to build it so that the Hidden Commander is a closer but not the only way to win
Josh does it because he wants all five colors because he can’t build a good Nekusar deck in Grixis?
Also you’re now a 99 card deck if your Commander is useless to your main strategy.
Savage!!!
@don’s Oloro mono-black works because Oloro provides value from the CZ that feeds a lot of mono-Black tech.

I wouldn't call it poor deckbuilding, but I would definitely say it's a strategy he praises too often. He owns a number of original dual lands that allow him the budget to make strategies like that possible. I don't think it's wise for the average player.
But using Chromat or so that’s just there and you never plan on casting I never liked as a deck building strategy.
I think there's merit as long as redundancy is there. Like, if I run Glissa the traitor I have more than just Shirei available to provide redundancy.
I can also work Toshiro Umezawa in and shift gears into removal mode or just net value from my green spells.
Or pod into Meren and force an answer.
If your Commander feeds the strategy that’s fine.

I can understand the impulse. There's no Jund -1/-1 counters commander, for example, so many players pick a random Jund guy and use Hapatra and Scorpion God in the 99. If there's a hole in the legendary creature roster, players want to fill it somehow
Yeah, that's why I liked K&T for Omnom. Helps put out lands or draw you cards so you can hit your land drops
Honestly you might as well run Ramos for anything like that since he feeds all strategies.
And there's a surprising amount of nice support cards for elementals in blue and white
Hehehe, Ramos was nicknamed the Value Engine in my meta, Henry :stuck_out_tongue:
The most generic, yet useful of the 5-color commanders.
Agreed. Ramos is bonkers.
Also having a huge flying Commander that passively gets bigger just from you casting spells can finish games.
As a plan of last resort
I've seem Xira Arien built as scorp/patra
When in doubt, hit someone with a big dragon
Quick, I need a board state. Someone get me a dragon.
[[!shivan dragon]] :stuck_out_tongue: Found one!
He’s an artifact creature so he’s also naturally immune to the older, more efficient mono-black removal. He blocks creatures with fear/intimidate, etc.
To be fair, he's weak to artifact hate at the same time
Shatter kills someone's Commander now
But that's the cast with Bosh, too
Sure but again you don’t rely upon the Commander so you don’t care. Just remove the counters for the mana
Case^ And that's not saying Ramos and Bosh are on the same level
Let them waste their removal and cast him again.
You know, I didn't think of it, but Kruphix has to be a great card in a Ramos deck
Ramos presents a fairly unique problem for opponents because using art hate on him usually means allowing something as nasty or worse to remain on table.
Can be, but unless you’re putting a ton of counters on each turn it doesn’t buy you that much.
You could save 10 mana, which isn’t nothing.
Do I let the value train roll on or is that Mimic Vat/Pod posing more of a threat. It's a serious issue?
That's very true. Both are amazingly valuable targets
Ramos is on that Based God level of awesome
He's got so many build options too.
Yup. He’s truly just an Engine.

I think if you built him as a value creature with whatever strategy built in, sure. Or did the Xira Aren thing w/ a generically fine commander for the color access, I'd be fine with that to. But the "i'm going to use this as a cover up for my actual 'commander'" isn't my jam. I don't know if it's poor deckbuilding, do whatever you want to do since it's EDH, I just know I wouldn't do it
The "Cromat that is actually Nekusar" just seems like wasted energy and like Henry said, you're hosed if ANYTHING goes wrong
My general is Anafenza the Foremost, I'll be running Karador, Athreos, Teysa, and Ayli.
Pft, because running Anafenza isn't a horrible thing to do :stuck_out_tongue: Says the graveyard player >D
I’ve seen a Ramos spellslinger deck that is pretty interesting (and doesn’t care about Anafenza) ;-)
Runs a lot of the charms to quickly pump Ramos.
[[Abzan Charm]], [[Jund Charm]] are the top two.

attachments.fallback: Abzan Charm {W}{B}{G} // Instant // Choose one — // • Exile target creature with power 3 or greater. // • You draw two cards and you lose 2 life. // • Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.
attachments.text:
Instant
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with power 3 or greater.
• You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
• Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.
attachments.title: Abzan Charm {W}{B}{G}

attachments.fallback: Jund Charm {B}{R}{G} // Instant // Choose one — // • Exile all cards from target player's graveyard. // • Jund Charm deals 2 damage to each creature. // • Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
attachments.text:
Instant
Choose one —
• Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
• Jund Charm deals 2 damage to each creature.
• Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
_Jund pulses with raw energy, waiting for shamans to shape it into useful form._
attachments.title: Jund Charm {B}{R}{G}

text: Hidden also lets you run colors you might not normally have access too. Hidden Locust God might add access to black stuff like Underworld Dreams and Megrim for wheels, etc.
Yeah, like I said before, K&T gave me access to Blue and White. The removal of White and the card advantage of Blue was nice
You also get access to one of my favorite combos, [[Retreat to Coralhelm]] and [[Ruin Ghost]]

attachments.fallback: Retreat to Coralhelm {2}{U} // Enchantment // Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one — // • You may tap or untap target creature. // • Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
attachments.text:
Enchantment
_Landfall_ — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, choose one —
• You may tap or untap target creature.
• Scry 1. _(Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)_
attachments.title: Retreat to Coralhelm {2}{U}

attachments.fallback: Ruin Ghost {1}{W} // Creature — Spirit // {W}, {T}: Exile target land you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control. // 1/1
attachments.text:
Creature — Spirit
{W}, {T}: Exile target land you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.
_The Forsaken Ones haunt the ruins that flicker in and out of the spirit realm. Such sites are hard to find and even harder to loot._
*1/1*
attachments.title: Ruin Ghost {1}{W}

text: That only works once unless you have haste though, right?
